Do you believe everything you're told?
Riot Day 1: We're making ChampionX
Forum Day 3: Champion Concept
Riot Day 5: ChampionX will be like this...
Forum Day 7: Artwork for new Champion!
Riot Day 9: ChampionX will look like this...

You're naïve. Riot says ABSOLUTELY nothing about champions, other than "we're making one". Then, they slowly release more information. This relationship is a "Time-Hole", magicians use this trick to make you think they can read your mind. It's when you're distracted by time frames, and information is tossed around freely- then you place this information in the wrong time frame- so when that information comes out, it appears they were ahead of the time. Here's an example:

A card trick: I will read your mind.
Pick a card, and memorize it. No matter what I ask- you have to remember this card. 
Q1- Think of a color, and I will write that color on this paper.
-I write down the card I made them choose, ask their color and crumple the paper.
Q2- Think of a City, and I will write it on this paper.
-I write the color from the previous question, ask their city and crumple the paper.
Q3- Think of a person, and I will write the name on this paper.
-I write the city from the previous question, ask the name of the person and crumple the paper.
Q4- Think of your card, and I will draw it on this paper.
-I write the name of the person from the previous question, ask the card and crumple the paper. 
Then I ask the person to retrieve the crumpled papers, and read them. They will believe I read their mind. 

That is you- lacking any real observation skills to maintain an intelligent position in such affairs.

Meanwhile you're blindly assuming that this new champ is an imitation of your own when based on this 1:30 video, virtually nothing coincides with your concept (and yes I read it, she's a... unique, if somewhat bland supporting type of champ) except the tree/plant imagery that showed up part way through the video. This champion is certainly not based off of your concept in the slightest (it's a dude that shoots people, not a nature spirit healer/debuffer), and if you were trying to farm upvotes or hijack the thread, it's backfired hard. If you weren't, then I'm sorry you're just arrogant, ignorant, and misinformed.

As an actual artist and designer, I can tell you from first-hand experience that a design (as in a real, innovative/creative and unique creation) takes days and days of brainstorming. That is only to get the initial conceptual work done. Then you have to prototype several versions, then you have to finalize the design. Okay, now you have a design that you like, that takes a week or so to get finished. However, that is still only the initial design. Now you go to producing the design, which takes a fair bit of time depending on resources required. Then you have to continue testing, and fix problems that you didn't find initially. Sometimes, and this is actually a frequent occurrence, you have to scrap a concept and choose a different prototype. Once you finalize that part, you have to polish your creation (which in the case of a champion in LoL would be things like VFX, VO, and fine tuning the models and textures. Then you have to market it (which as you can see is already very far into the process, and in this case is directly analogous to these "deadeye" teasers). Once you market it you test it (PBE) and then once the initial screening is complete, you release it to the general public. 

This is no "Time Hole" this is just the standard design process. Hopefully this sheds some light on how this whole system works.

Not just game development... Development in general. 

Its true that these two may seem similar, but Jhin doesn't relate to any of his champs selected, there's only two images of plants, and he made a girl while this is a dude with a mask (who was said to be very creepy). 

As someone who's dabbled in animation and in making games, I understand that this video alone took a lot of time to make.

First: exhibit A is the amount of texture put into each random person (as they didn't use Garen, Sona, Zed, or Vi). Not only their designs but their bodies.

Second, after taking up drawing, it takes a good number of hours just to draw and color lips as realistic as the ones seen. On top of that, they were animated (with smoke coming out).

Third, nothing seems recycled from anything I've previously seen which means that although theirs barely motion happening, there was a lot of work done just to make the characters.

Fourth, even if live actors were used to make this, the amount of VFX (visual effects) and scenes are enough to be about two and half to maybe even three weeks of work.

I could go on, but there is no possible way, that his post could had been read and within about even two months would a champion like this be made, tested, approved, and then get teasers.
